title: 1st1^{st}1st and 2nd2^{nd}2nd Derivatives
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) = e^{ax} \\sin 2x "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", what is the value of the positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that satisfies the equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f''(x) - 2a f'(x) + 2a^2 f(x) = 0 ? "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

A circle  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\xi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  passes through  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B, M"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" meets the sides  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB, BC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" again at  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P, Q"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", respectively. Let  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the point such that

Suppose  that  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" lies on the circumcircle of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle ABC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 1st Math Riddle 2019
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A small number of cards has been lost from a complete pack. If I deal among four people, three cards remain. If I deal among three people, two remain and if I deal among five people, two cards remain. How many cards are there?"}]}]}

title: 1st October with Modulus?!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2X = 1 (mod Y),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2Y = 10 (mod X),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the least possible sum of X and Y, where X and Y are positive integers greater than 1."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You can start with 2 cases, the 1st case minimising X and the 2nd case minimising Y."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X must be at least 11, but no possible solution works when X = 11."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"When X = 12, Y = 23."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let's minimising Y. 2Y = 10, so Y becomes 5."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ones digit of 2X must be either 1 or 6, and since 2X is even, 6 is the only possibility. X can be ending with 3 or 8 for multiplication, so since X is at least 11, X is minimally 13."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The least possible sum is 5 + 13 = "},{"type":"text","text":"18.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1st Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all the roots of the following equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \LARGE { 4x }^{ 2}  + { x } - 3 = 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Write the sum in the form of a simplified fraction "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac { a }{ b } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[If the sum is 2, write it as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac { 2 }{ 1 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"]"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[If the sum is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac { 4 }{ 2 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", write it as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac { 2 }{ 1 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Write your answer as |a+b|. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Use the Vieta's Formula, where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_1 + r_2 = -\frac {b}{a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". 
So we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_1 + r_2 = -\frac {1}{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". 
That means that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-\frac {1}{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the sum of the two roots of this equation. 
The question stated to write the answer as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b + a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-1 + 4 = 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{-1}{4}=\frac{1}{-4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".Therefore answer could be 3 or -3. The question should indeed ask |a+b|.
